Dear Mr. Ausmus;
It gives me great pleasure, on behalf of our Board of Directors,
to tell you that the Board, at its meeting on January 20, 1954,
approved a grant of $7,000 for one year beginning April 1, 1954
to the National Association of Educational Broadcasters to
possible the establishment of a regular, comprehensive personnel
service aimed at serving the needs of the entire field of
educational television and radio. A check in the amount of $7,000
will be sent by our accounting department to Mr. Harry J. Skornia,
Executive Director of the National Association of Educational
Broadcasters.
Our Directors understand that this service will place on an
organized and more efficient basis the placement and personnel
classification functions at present handled by a variety of
organizations. It is understood that the director and secretary
of the placement bureau will be full-time staff employees of the
National Association of Educational Broadcasters. Systematic
efforts will be made by them to maintain files as nearly complete
as possible on all qualified personnel seeking positions in the
fields of educational television and radio. This service by the
Association will be made generally known both among its member
stations and others, and inquiries from all sources, whether NAEB
members or not, concerning personnel will be given full attention.
In short, it is understood that this grant will make it possible
for the NAEB to meet all present and prospective needs for a
general personnel placement service in all aspects of educational
television and radio.
Our Board would appreciate a progress report on this project in
time for our annual meeting, which will take place in October 1954.
Such a report should be in our hands by the first of October. At
the close of your fiscal year we should appreciate an audited
financial statement with respect to the project.
